system.description:
A lesser noble of Hive Desoleum has been struck by sudden and violent madness. Your Inquisitor suspects the hand of the archenemy.

  • Travel to Hesentanz Manor in the Apex and gain entry to the Guljian estate.
  • Examine the circumstances of Lans Guljian's descent into insanity.
  • Locate and recover the black orb—a xenos artefact believed to be the source of his affliction.
  • Identify the supplier who delivered the artefact to the Guljian household and follow any leads.

The trail of proscribed xenos artefacts leads from the Apex down into the underhive. A network of smugglers and criminals must be unravelled.

  • Make contact with the Babyfaces gang at the Screaming Wheel cantina to trace the supply chain.
  • Follow the trail to the Sable Trader Zax Holthane, operating from Three Stakes' Rest.
  • Capture or interrogate Holthane to learn the source of the smuggled goods and the details of incoming shipments.

Corruption has taken root within the port authority of Hive Desoleum. Shuttle landing records have been doctored to conceal incoming smuggler vessels.

  • Proceed to Port Gyre and investigate irregularities in the docking manifests.
  • Identify the official responsible for falsifying records—suspected to be Prefect Gaius Anteshern.
  • Determine the time and location of the next incoming smuggler's shuttle.

A smuggler's lighter carrying proscribed cargo is inbound. This shipment must not reach its intended recipient.

  • Intercept Arvus Lighter 341 Beta-Sky at Landing Platform Tertius-9.
  • Prevent delivery of the cargo to the arch-heretek Somnius Halbrel—by force, boarding, or covert observation.
  • Recover or destroy all xenos artefacts aboard the vessel.

The Daemonhost Suvfaeras has broken free of its bindings and fled into the tunnels beneath Port Gyre. Every moment it remains at large, it grows stronger.

  • Track the Daemonhost through the Underport before it regains full strength.
  • Contend with the arch-heretek Halbrel's forces, who pursue the entity for their own vile purposes.
  • Destroy or banish the Daemonhost at all costs. Failure is not an option.

A perfectly smooth black orb, heavy and cold to the touch, about the size of a clenched fist. It never rolls—when placed on a slanted surface, it slides, but its orientation never changes. Of clearly xenos origin and potentially millions of years old.

After carrying the orb for a few hours, the bearer experiences visions of a vast and barren alien landscape, studded with massive and bizarre structures. This requires a Fear (1) test. Visions repeat at irregular intervals and continue as long as the bearer is in proximity to the orb. A psyker can sense the stink of the Warp on a Routine (+20) Psyniscience test.

The orb is extremely dangerous and should be recovered for the Inquisitor.

A small box of black metal containing what appears to be the mummified hand of an alien creature, with three clawed fingers. Found hidden beneath a floor grate in Holthane's manufactorum.

The hand is of no obvious function but is clearly of xenos origin, linking Holthane to the Trade Sable. If brought within half a metre of the black orb from Guljian's study, the hand twitches slightly.

The hand should be recovered and turned over to the Inquisitor for examination.
